name: The Council of European Professional Informatics Societies
membership: CEN/TC 428, European Cyber Security Organisation (ECSO) European Internet Forum (EIF), Conference of INGOs of the Council of Europe,  Innovation Value Institute (IVI), European Centre for Women in Technology (ECWT), European e-Skills Association (EeSA)
goal: The Council of European Professional Informatics Societies (CEPIS) is a non-profit organisation seeking to improve and promote a high standard among informatics professionals in recognition of the impact that Informatics has on employment, business and society. CEPIS represents 29 Member Societies in 28 countries across greater Europe.
interests: Business and Industry, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Research and innovation
euInitiatives: Programme 'Digital Europe', New Skills Agenda, the ‘Digital Skills and Jobs Coalition’, Key Competences for Lifelong Learning, European Qualifications Framework, Blueprint for Sectoral Cooperation on Skills, Digital Education Action Plan.
